condition.description:
If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. Over time, this can damage your eyes. The most common problem is diabetic retinopathy. It is a leading cause of blindness in American adults.

Your retina is the light-sensitive tissue at the back of your eye. You need a healthy retina to see clearly. Diabetic retinopathy damages the tiny blood vessels inside your retina.

You may not notice it at first. Symptoms can include

  • Blurry or double vision
  • Rings, flashing lights, or blank spots
  • Dark or floating spots
  • Pain or pressure in one or both of your eyes
  • Trouble seeing things out of the corners of your eyes

Treatment often includes laser treatment or surgery, with follow-up care.

Two other eye problems can happen to people with diabetes. A cataract is a cloud over the lens of your eye. Surgery helps you see clearly again. Glaucoma happens when pressure builds up in the eye, damaging the main nerve. Eye drops or surgery can help.

If you have diabetes, you should have a complete eye exam every year. Finding and treating problems early may save your vision.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
indications: diabetic vision loss prevention and treatment
condition.name: Diabetic retinopathy (vision loss)

indications: Diabetic vision loss prevention and treatment

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

clock.tip: Works faster on an empty stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Atorvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Atorvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.
One of the strongest cholesterol-lowering statin medications.
A good option for people who have high cholesterol and diabetes.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: I am a long distance bicyclist and have always been active. I have Familial hyper-cholesterolemia, which  is a genetic disorder caused by a defect on chromosome 19. I have tried alternatives but Rx lowered my cholesterol 400 to 200.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

Annoying muscle pain about 3X over ten years, each time in a different muscle zone, which can be discouraging. Hot showers, working pressure pts. = relief.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: retired, peripheral artery disease and s

userStories.tip: I had a moderate Cholesterol. This medication brought it down to normal levels. I am using it as a short cut to avoid worrying about what I eat. I am not a foodie, don't eat fast foods, so I had very limited choice for diet control.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Actually stopped. Taking it made me feel like I'd been hit by a Mack truck. Didn't lower my cholesterol. I feel so much better after stopping. I won't ever take it again.

hardest part was establishing the habit to take it before going to sleep. Still rely on Mango app as reminder.

drugs.name: Atorvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.
risk_factors: Prior history of chronic liver disease

description_processed.orig: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Birth defects
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

risks_warnings.title: Urinary tract infections
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of colds and flu
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

carousel_items: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after eating.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or change in taste sensation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Captopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Captopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function, but you have to take it on an empty stomach.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Compared to other ACE inhibitors, less flexible on when and how you take it. Captopril needs to be taken multiple times a day on an empty stomach.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Compared to other ACE inhibitors, less flexible on when and how you take it. Captopril needs to be taken multiple times a day on an empty stomach.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

drugs.name: Captopril

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after eating.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or change in taste sensation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Captopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Captopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Cough
risks_warnings.description: Taking Captopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

description_processed.orig: Taking Captopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Captopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Captopril.

description_processed.orig: Captopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Captopril.

carousel_items: Short-acting insulin good for blood sugar control around meal times.
Take 5 to 10 minutes before a meal. Effects last for 2-4 hours.
Can cause weight gain and low blood sugar.
Make sure you and your family know the symptoms of low blood sugar: sweating, shakiness, weakness, fast heartbeat, nervousness, headache, blurry vision, trouble thinking clearly, or passing out.
Always have a good source of sugar nearby for low blood sugar episodes.
Make sure you understand how to give yourself the injections.
When mixing with another insulin (such as insulin NPH), draw this insulin into the syringe first.
Don't shake the vial. Store unopened vials in the refrigerator. Opened vials are good at room temperature for 28 days.
Check your blood sugar levels every day.

basics.benefits_moa: Humalog is a short-acting insulin medicine for diabetes. It acts like the insulin that your body normally makes to process sugars and fats, and it keeps your blood sugar stable after meals.
basics.bottom_line: Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides meal-time sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

upsides: Insulin is the most effective blood sugar-lowering medicine. When used correctly, it'll lower blood sugar every time you use it and prevent the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides sugar control after meals.
Dose can be easily adjusted to make a customized regimen that's tailored to your body.
Starting insulin early in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes can maintain your body's insulin-producing cells and slow down disease progression.
Okay to use even if you have liver or kidney problems, unlike most other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

upsides_processed.orig: Insulin is the most effective blood sugar-lowering medicine. When used correctly, it'll lower blood sugar every time you use it and prevent the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides sugar control after meals.
Dose can be easily adjusted to make a customized regimen that's tailored to your body.
Starting insulin early in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes can maintain your body's insulin-producing cells and slow down disease progression.
Okay to use even if you have liver or kidney problems, unlike most other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

userStories.tip: Beware the subtle way hypoglycemia can come about. Check your blood sugar often.

At the end of a 3ml vial, it has lost effectiveness.  I don't refrigerate after inserting in pen, but it should be stable for a couple of weeks.  I live in Germany, so it isn't especially hot.  Anyone else notice this?
faster acting than previous human insulin.    Have never had problems, other than one has to be careful of hypo events if you delay eating after taking a shot.  Can come on quite strong.

Take 5 to 10 minutes before a meal. Effects last for 2-4 hours.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening low blood sugar (Hypoglycemia)
risks_warnings.description: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.
risk_factors: Use of other blood sugar lowering medicines

description_processed.orig: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.

risks_warnings.title: Complications due to low potassium
risks_warnings.description: Humalog can decrease the amount of potassium that is available to be used in your body. Unmanaged low potassium can cause heart problems, trouble breathing or death.
risk_factors: Use of other medicine that lowers potassium

description_processed.orig: Humalog can decrease the amount of potassium that is available to be used in your body. Unmanaged low potassium can cause heart problems, trouble breathing or death.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility for severe and life-threatening allergy to Humalog. Stop use and seek immediate medical attention for any signs of trouble breathing or rash.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility for severe and life-threatening allergy to Humalog. Stop use and seek immediate medical attention for any signs of trouble breathing or rash.

carousel_items: Long-acting insulin good for baseline blood sugar control.
Works in 1 hour and lasts about 24 hours.
Can cause weight gain and low blood sugar.
Make sure you and your family know the symptoms of low blood sugar: sweating, shakiness, weakness, fast heartbeat, nervousness, headache, blurry vision, trouble thinking clearly, or passing out.
Always have a good source of sugar nearby for low blood sugar episodes.
Take it at the same time every day.
Make sure you understand how to give yourself the injections.
Don't shake the vial or mix with another insulin. Store unopened vials in the refrigerator. Opened vials are good at room temperature for 28 days.
Check your blood sugar levels every day.

basics.benefits_moa: Levemir is a long-acting insulin medicine for diabetes. It acts like the insulin that your body normally makes to process sugars and fats, and it keeps your blood sugar stable throughout the day.
basics.bottom_line: Levemir is a long-acting insulin that provides all-day sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar every day.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar every day.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

upsides: Insulin is the most effective blood sugar-lowering medicine. When used correctly, it'll lower blood sugar every time you use it and prevent the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Levemir is a long-lasting insulin that provides consistent, all-day sugar control with less risk of low blood sugar.
Dose can be easily adjusted to make a customized regimen that's tailored to your body.
Starting insulin early in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes can maintain your body's insulin-producing cells and slow down disease progression.
Okay to use even if you have liver or kidney problems, unlike most other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

points.hlt: physical examination procedures and organ system status

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Lisinopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Lisinopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

userStories.tip: good

I'm only on a 2.5mg dose because I have low blood pressure, 70/60 at times. I started when I was 9 and so you can imagine I played a lot of sports and unfortunately my medicine was causing me to pass out a lot. Check your BP regularly!
Make sure to tell your doctor if you feel dizzy after taking this medication, many times it's an indication you are taking too high of a dose
I wish I had known about the dry cough issue

When I started this medication, I really felt very calm. It is like when the rain stops, you realize how noisy it was few seconds ago. But I got the ugly side effect of coughing which did not go away until 1 month after I stopped taking.
Had severe muscle pain (enough to make walking/biking almost impossible) at the 20mg dose, had to go down to 10mg dose.
Dry Cough - Deal with it. It's a lot cheaper and more effective than other meds that don't have this side-effect.

it made me very anxious.  I found out by accident when I fell and hurt my knee, which swelled & required a compression bandage. I changed to HCTZ and stopped Lisinopril, and in 2 weeks all of my anxiety disappeared!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: I take in the a.m. and it seems to work better for me
Started out at too high a dosage--lowered blood pressure to 72/45, very dizzy and odd-feeling. Dropped to one-half the first dosage, much better at 100/60.
I take max dose (80mg) split between AM and PM. Also have found that some generic manufactures do not work well for me.
If I take it in the morning I get a headache and a cough; in the evening a cough for a while and maybe a headache. I'm only taking 5mg/day.
Take in evening.
remember to take it daily

drugs.name: Lisinopril

off-label_indications.indication: Diabetic vision loss prevention and treatment

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Lisinopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Lisinopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Cough
risks_warnings.description: Taking Lisinopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Lisinopril. If you find this bothersome, discuss with your doctor for other options.

description_processed.orig: Taking Lisinopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Lisinopril. If you find this bothersome, discuss with your doctor for other options.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Lisinopril. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Lisinopril. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Lisinopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Lisinopril.

description_processed.orig: Lisinopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Lisinopril.
